title: Conor McGregor fires back at UFC boss Dana White
text:
Conor McGregor has fired back at UFC boss Dana White on social media after he claimed the Irishman 'isn't the man anymore.'

McGregor lost his last UFC bout to Khabib Nurmagomedov last October and hasn't fought since, leading White to say that Khabib is the new shotcaller in the division.

Khabib won his most recent fight with a submission victory over Dustin Poirier in Abu Dhabi last month.

Conor McGregor has lashed out at UFC boss Dana White on social media after recent words

White said that McGregor 'isn't the man anymore' and that Khabib 'calls the shots' now

White told The Boston Globe: 'Khabib is the man now. Conor isn’t the man anymore, so Khabib gets to sit back and call the shots.'

McGregor was understandably displeased with this statement.

'Who’s not the man? Your man had that marquee event did he? More like an event in a marquee,' tweeted an angry McGregor, who is currently on bail after allegedly punching a man at a Dublin pub in April.

'A tent in the f****** sand it was. Keep spoofing to your self horse. Jock strap sniffer championships.'

White is keen to get McGregor back in the octagon, but it will not be until next year

Khabib got another submissing win at UFC 242, but McGregor also slammed the event

Attendance for UFC 242 at the du Arena on Yas Island in the UAE was thought to be low, and actual figures were not released after the event.

McGregor wants a rematch fight against Khabib, but the Russian is likely to face Tony Ferguson next. A bout against George St. Pierre is also on the cards.

The Irishman has also called on White to book a December fight against Frankie Edgar, with McGregor saying he will donate his purse to charity.

White has dismissed that particular fight as Edgar is two weight classes below The Notorious, but seems keen to get McGregor back in action in 2020.

A potential fight could arise between McGregor and the winner of Nate Diaz and Jorge Masvidal at UFC 244.
description: Conor McGregor has fired back at UFC boss Dana White on social media after he claimed the Irishman 'isn't the man anymore.'
